intro: Polycarena linearifoha, commonly known as the slender thread-leaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to South America and thrives in moist, temperate climates. Polycarena linearifoha is often found in shaded, woodland environments where it contributes to the understory vegetation.
